column2: And what is it I've to be proud of, ma'am? politely inquired Freckles.

column2: Why, a whole worldful of things, cried the Angel explosively.
column3: Why, a whole worldful of things, cried the Angel explosively.

column2: You can be proud that you've never even once disappointed him or failed in what he believed you could do.

column2: You can be proud over the way everyone speaks of you with trust and honor, and about how brave of heart and strong of body you are I heard a big man say a few days ago that the Limberlost was full of disagreeable things--positive dangers, unhealthful as it could be, and that since the memory of the first settlers it has been a rendezvous for runaways, thieves, and murderers.

column2: Why, I should think you would just parade around about proper over that!

column2: He says that if the Irish had decent territory they'd lead the world.

column2: Irishmen, of course!

column3: The Angel arose, made an elaborate old time bow, and holding up the banjo, recited in clipping feet and meter, with rhythmic swing and a touch of brogue that was simply irresistible:

column3: The cold chain of silence had hung o'er thee long [She muted the strings with her rosy palm];

column3: Then proudly, my own Irish harp, I unbound thee [She threw up her head and swept a ringing harmony];
